triples.name: Evaluation of binary classifiers
triples.relevance: The paper proposes that MCC is the superior metric for evaluating binary classifiers compared to other metrics.

triples.name: Confusion matrix
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes confusion matrix components (true positives, true negatives, false positives, false negatives) as the foundation for the metrics evaluated.

triples.name: Binary classification
triples.relevance: The paper focuses specifically on evaluating binary (two-class) classification problems.

triples.name: Phi coefficient
triples.relevance: The paper notes that the Matthews correlation coefficient is mathematically equivalent to the phi coefficient.

triples.name: F-score
triples.relevance: The paper compares MCC to the F1 score, showing that MCC is more reliable in binary classification evaluation.

triples.name: Precision and recall
triples.relevance: The paper uses precision and recall concepts which underlie the evaluation metrics being compared.

triples.name: Youden's J statistic
triples.relevance: Bookmaker informedness (BM) is mathematically related to Youden's J statistic, which the paper analyzes as an alternative metric.

triples.name: Accuracy and precision
triples.relevance: The paper compares MCC to accuracy, demonstrating why MCC is more informative than accuracy alone for binary classification.
